trades.name: Project Cleanup & Debris Disposal
trades.note: Comprehensive project cleanup and debris disposal from painting, installation, protection, contents, electrical, demolition, cleanup, access, hardware, miscellaneous, flooring work across all project areas

items.name: Project final cleaning
items.description:
Final construction cleaning required due to drywall dust, debris tracking, and material transport throughout 3009.51 SF of work area.

Cleaning includes dust removal from surfaces, fixtures, and HVAC systems affected by painting, installation, protection, contents, electrical, demolition, cleanup, access, hardware, miscellaneous, flooring work.

items.name: Dumpster rental (15-yard, 2 weeks)
items.description:
15-yard dumpster rental for 2 weeks.
Includes rental fees ($900.00), delivery/pickup service ($150.00), and landfill tipping fees ($30.80) for 0.88 tons of debris.

items.name: Dumpster delivery/pickup service
items.description: Service charge for dumpster logistics (delivery and final pickup).

items.name: Landfill/Disposal (Tipping) Fees
items.description: Landfill/recycling facility fees for 0.88 tons debris ($30.80).

items.name: Debris hauling labor (on-site)
items.description: On-site labor for debris hauling and loading (0.88 tons). Includes base hauling cost and multi-story/basement access surcharge.

bottom_note:
OVERHEAD(10%):
Project Management: complex interior project requiring significant trade coordination complexity interior restoration requiring coordination of 11 trades across 8 rooms spanning 3009.51 SF.
Administrative Costs: Include project documentation, permitting, scheduling, material procurement, and quality control oversight for high coordination requirements.
Insurance & Bonding: General liability, workers' compensation, and performance bonding based on project scope and risk assessment.
Equipment & Infrastructure: Tools, equipment rental, vehicle costs, and job site utilities necessary for project completion over 33.5 days timeline.
Special Conditions: Additional overhead required for difficult access which increases project management complexity.

PROFIT(4%):
Market Rate: 4% reflects current market standards for professional restoration contractors performing interior restoration work in VA region.
Risk Management: Compensation for financial investment, project risk, performance guarantee, and business sustainability for complex interior project requiring significant trade coordination complexity projects.
Value Creation: Professional expertise, warranty coverage, industry knowledge, and quality assurance that ensures successful project completion to pre-loss condition.

This rate structure ensures proper resource allocation, professional execution, and successful project completion while maintaining industry standards for quality and reliability.
disclaimer: This estimate reflects restoration to pre-loss condition using Like Kind and Quality materials. Overhead and Profit rates reflect industry standards for the determined complexity level.
